main event: A military officer sighted 5 or 6 white, circular objects flying in close formation at a speed of 285 MPH near Lake Meade, Nevada on 28 June 1947.
interesting points: The observer was flying an F-51 at an altitude of approximately 10,000 feet when the sighting occurred., The objects were moving in a course of 120 degrees., The estimated size of the objects was approximately 36 inches in diameter., The officer distinctly noted that the objects were not conventional aircraft or birds due to their speed and formation., The sighting lasted long enough to establish a clear description, although the exact length of observation was not reported.
sighted object: five or six white, circular objects
witness description: 1st Lt. from the 170th AAF Base Unit, Ferry Division
